Data: Angelo Mathews to Watson, 1 run a thick inside edge to a clumpy, leaden-footed defensive by Watson. Ball could've gone anywhere
Angelo Mathews to Warner, no run Warner steps forward, driving to point
Angelo Mathews to Warner, no run beautiful timing but this time he picks out cover
Angelo Mathews to Warner, OUT got him! Slightly shorter by Matthews and Warner cuts and slaps it straight into the hands of point!
Angelo Mathews to Ponting, no run shoulders arms outside off - and this one's a right old grubber. Scoots through low to the keeper
Angelo Mathews to Ponting, no run Ponting comes forward and defends with a squirt of the blade to point
Jayasuriya to Watson, 1 run flat, on middle and defended
Jayasuriya to Ponting, no run flicked around the corner
Jayasuriya to Ponting, 1 run goes for a pull but can't time it, and they scamper a single
Jayasuriya to Watson, 1 run clamps onto this, driving to mid-on
Jayasuriya to Ponting, FOUR runs beautiful, orthodox back-foot drive! That's classical and elegant
Jayasuriya to Ponting, no run drives to mid-off
Angelo Mathews to Watson, no run Watson tries to pull but somehow can't connect. It begged to be smacked over midwicket but it just rushed onto him a little
Angelo Mathews to Watson, 1 run flicked behind square and they set off for a single - this'll be tight, but Jayawardene's throw is wide!
Angelo Mathews to Ponting, FOUR runs goes for a cut and inside-edges it past his stumps for four! It's all a bit harum-scarum here
Angelo Mathews to Ponting, 3 runs oh, shot. But that's a poor effort at extra cover, the ball flying through his legs
Angelo Mathews to Watson, no run the wrong line and it's flicked off his pads, but there's a short fine-leg to prevent the single
Angelo Mathews to Watson, 1 wide down the leg side and Sangakkara roars an appeal, more in hope of it not being wided than a genuine shout
Angelo Mathews to Watson, no run Watson defends to cover, coming massively forward ala Hayden
Udana to Ponting, 1 run on middle-and-off, Ponting drives watchfully without power to the diving mid-off. Good, sprawling stop
Udana to Watson, FOUR runs lofted with ugly, caveman power over long-on. Really did smack that!
Udana to Watson, FOUR runs fortuitous shot. A thick outside edge flies down to third man, but good intent showed by Watson here, unsettling the young bowler
Udana to Watson, SIX runs six more! Beautiful from Watson, just picking it up off his legs and timing it magnificently. Bish, bash, bosh
Udana to Watson, no run angled across him and Watson shaped to play before withdrawing his bat at the last moment
Udana to Watson, no run slower ball - 59mph - which he tried to slap through midwicket but missed
Malinga to Ponting, FOUR runs starts with a delivery much too straight. Ponting needs no second invitation, clipping it with excellent timing down to fine leg

Malinga to Ponting, FOUR runs fantastic stroke from Ponting once more. Came walking down the pitch, opened the face and cracked it square of the wicket - that bounced quite a bit, but he rode it quite perfectly. Top, top shot
Malinga to Ponting, FOUR runs mistimed over mid-on - and only just over the fielder. I thought initially he'd hit the cover off it, but he clearly hadn't
Malinga to Ponting, 2 wide a full bunger down the leg side
Malinga to Watson, no run outside off, Watson chips to point
Malinga to Watson, no run tries to clip this off his legs but can't time it at all
Malinga to Watson, 1 run a full toss at 86.7mph (75.34 knots, 38.76 metres-per-second), bashed back to the bowler
Mendis to Watson, no run that's missed everything I think! The zooter hurries on, Watson didn't pick it and it flicked his pad on the way through - excellent take
Mendis to Watson, no run short of a length and defended out to mid-off. Short mid-off, actually
Mendis to Watson, 1 run short, pulled
Mendis to Ponting, no run and this one bounces, Ponting goes back and defends out to the off side
Mendis to Ponting, no run good pace, 57mph, and Ponting pushes it out cautiously to the off side
Mendis to Ponting, OUT bowled him! Ponting stepped outside leg trying to smite him over cover but loses his leg stump. Looked to me like a leggie from Mendis
Jayasuriya to Watson, 1 run short of a length and nicely tucked off his hip
Jayasuriya to Haddin, 1 run flatter and quicker, patted to leg
Jayasuriya to Watson, 1 run well wide of the off stump, no feet movement and Watson reaches for it, slapping it back past the bowler
Jayasuriya to Haddin, no run down the pitch, he tries to flip him over midwicket but gets a thick inside edge to the lurking man at short fine leg. No run there
Jayasuriya to Haddin, SIX runs shot. Shot indeed. Down onto one knee to this quicker ball and sweeps him out of the ground. This guy is some batsman
Jayasuriya to Haddin, 1 run dances down the pitch with ballerina-fast feet, flicking him to wide long-on
Mendis to Haddin, no run fuller delivery, jabs down on it
Mendis to Haddin, 1 run quicker ball flicked to leg
Mendis to Watson, OUT gone! Watson attempts a horrible sweep to this very full and straight delivery, and he's hit on the back pad. Poor stroke - quality bowling
Mendis to Clarke, no run defends solidly

Mendis to Clarke, 2 runs flicked to fine leg for a single - no, they're coming back for two and the throw's accurate and hard. A direct hit would've had Clarke heading back to the dug-out, without a doubt
Mendis to Clarke, no run big shout as he went for a sweep - looks a very good shout to me, but it's not out
Udana to Haddin, no run forced off the back foot into the covers
Udana to Haddin, 2 runs very, very slow! Pats it out down to third man and they get two. This pair are so fast between the wickets - watching them is a great exercise for kids in how to run
Udana to Haddin, 1 run fuller delivery driven out to long-off
Udana to Clarke, 1 run very slow ball again outside off, guided down to third man who wings in a very accurate throw which knocks over the bails
Udana to Haddin, 1 run squeezed out to the off side
Udana to Clarke, no run back-cut to backward point
Murali to Haddin, 1 run down the pitch flicking to deep midwicket
Murali to Clarke, 1 run pulled to midwicket
Murali to Haddin, 1 run quicker ball which rushes onto him and he flicks it to midwicket
Murali to Clarke, 1 run onto the sweep and times it well but can't find the placement
Murali to Haddin, no run down the pitch, padding away
Murali to Haddin, no run flicked to leg
Malinga to Clarke, 1 wide down the leg side and wided
Malinga to Clarke, no run smashed to cover - absolutely nailed it
Malinga to Clarke, 1 run slower ball and he picks it, pushing it carefully to cover
Malinga to Haddin, no run faster, swinging delivery which beats the batsman's wild swing
Malinga to Haddin, 1 run sweetly timed but straight to a wide mid-off
Malinga to Clarke, 1 run flicked to leg
Malinga to Haddin, OUT bowled him! Comical cricket. A slower full-toss which Haddin seemed to pick, but it dipped late on him and splattered his stumps - the off stump and middle stump both flattened
Murali to Clarke, 1 run full, dug out
Murali to Hussey, no run on middle-and-leg, defended with haste
Murali to Hussey, no run nudged to leg - no run there!
Murali to Hussey, 1 run guides this out to the off side and they finally scamper a run
Murali to Clarke, no run quicker ball, down the pitch to defend
Murali to Clarke, 1 run down the leg side and turned to short fine-leg
Udana to Clarke, 2 runs swung over midwicket

Udana to Clarke, OUT another one done by a slower delivery. Are you watching, England? Superb delivery on middle-and-leg which Clarke picked, but got a leading edge back to the bowler who took a great low catch with his left hand
Udana to Hussey, no run turned to leg
Udana to Hussey, 1 wide another very slow ball but it's too wide this time to the left-hander
Udana to Hussey, 1 run another slower ball and cripes, this was close to shattering his stumps - a thick inside edge
Udana to Hussey, FOUR runs quicker ball and laced through the covers for four
Udana to Hussey, 1 run slower nut stroked to long-off
Murali to Hussey, no run rapped on the pads, huge shout - but it pitched outside the off stump. Just...and was a little high I think
Murali to Hussey, no run works it to leg
Murali to Hussey, no run the doosra squares him up, but he plays it well with late hands
Murali to Hussey, 1 run short, pulled through midwicket
Murali to Hussey, no run good, straight delivery - excellent pace, just quick enough to keep him honest
Murali to Hussey, no run flicked to leg to end a superbly parsimonious over
Mendis to Hussey, 2 runs short and quick, pulled with muscular power over midwicket
Mendis to Hussey, 1 run pushed out to the off side
Mendis to Johnson, FOUR runs that was almost a medium pacer - outside off and Johnson back-cut it for four. Top, top shot
Mendis to Johnson, no run the straightest of bats meets the straightest of deliveries
Mendis to Johnson, 1 run down the pitch, cracks it to long-off
Mendis to Hussey, 1 run half-tracker, pulled over midwicket but can't place it
Malinga to Hussey, 1 run another slower ball on middle-and-leg
Malinga to Johnson, 2 runs down the leg side and very full, chipped it uppishly and is fortunate that it falls safe at midwicket. Could've flown anywhere
Malinga to Johnson, 1 run another attempted yorker clipped to mid-on whose throw comes in and whacks Ian Gould (umpire) on the ankle!
Malinga to Hussey, 1 run slow bouncer, pulled to nowhere
Malinga to Johnson, no run oh great ball! Johnson completely deceived by this slower ball and somehow doesn't lose his off stump
Mendis to Hussey, no run nearly another wicket for Mendis! Outside off, he tried to pull it from wide of the off stump and got a bottom edge
Mendis to Hussey, no run patted back to Mendis, nearly into his hands!
Mendis to Hussey, SIX runs a monster from David Hussey! That is huge! Down the pitch and he absolutely nailed it into the sky, over the top, for six
Mendis to Hussey, 1 run flicked back to the bowler
Mendis to Hussey, OUT what bowling. What belief and guile from Mendis. A quicker and fuller ball to Hussey who's rapped absolutely dead in front. Too quick, too straight
Mendis to Johnson, no run comes back into the left-hander and really rushes him - that was heading onto his off stump! Just got his bat down in time
Murali to Hussey, 1 run stroked to mid-off
Murali to Johnson, SIX runs big, big six. He didn't quite time his sweep-slog, skying it miles in the air, but it just about had the legs on it
Murali to Johnson, 3 runs a carving slap off the back foot
Murali to Hussey, 1 run comes confidently forward onto the front foot, meeting the pitch of the ball and flicking to leg
Murali to Johnson, SIX runs sheesh, that is huge. A massive slog sweep - the noise of bat on ball was sweet as a nut! The timing perfect
Murali to Johnson, FOUR runs clipped off his pads down to third man for four. Easy
Udana to Hussey, SIX runs that. Is. Huge. Brilliant shot, getting his front foot out of the way and clobbering it wide of long-on. Ping!
Udana to Hussey, OUT tries to repeat the shot but slices it high and point swallows it with ease
Udana to Johnson, 1 run slower ball, picked by Johnson who works him to long-on
Udana to Lee, FOUR runs bang! Terrific blow by Lee, hammering this back past the bowler for four. Heavy power
Udana to Lee, SIX runs nailed it! Absolutely creamed this full toss over wide long-on. Huge, ugly power and great to watch
Udana to Lee, 1 run beaten by a slower ball, slicing it short of third man
Malinga to Lee, FOUR runs Lee steps to leg in classical tailender fashion in an attempt to scorch this over midwicket, but top-edges it over the keeper for four
Malinga to Lee, OUT what a yorker. Oh well bowled! Very, very fast and hit the base of the leg stump which is sent cartwheeling
Malinga to Hauritz, no run a little wide of the off stump - plays and misses
Malinga to Hauritz, FOUR runs clipped neatly off his legs for four down to fine leg
Malinga to Hauritz, OUT outside edge, another one for Malinga - well caught by Sangakkara low to his right
Malinga to Bracken, FOUR runs a thick inside edge for four! Great bonus for Australia there

7pm Well, 159 isn't the worst total, but Sri Lanka have been all over Australia this afternoon. Terrific bowling from Mendis and Malinga, and they ought to fancy themselves to chase 160. Back in 10 minutes, folks.
7.10pm Here we go. Lee to open
Lee to Dilshan, no run good, straight and fast delivery with which to start
Lee to Dilshan, FOUR runs thumping back-foot square-cut for four! Wonderful timing
Lee to Dilshan, (no ball) 1 run short, pulls it down to fine leg but it's a front-foot no ball
Lee to Jayasuriya, no run pulls and misses. I wish we had stats on how many times batsmen miss out on free-hits
Lee to Jayasuriya, no run full and fast, drilled to mid-off
Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 wide down the leg side and, whoopsy daisy - a wide
Lee to Jayasuriya, no run a beauty - oh what a ball! Try to play that! It nips back and cuts him in half
Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 run a quick run to cover
Johnson to Jayasuriya, no run crunching back-foot cut but backward point is alert
Johnson to Jayasuriya, 1 run swivels onto a pull to fine leg
Johnson to Dilshan, 2 runs cracked out through backward point
Johnson to Dilshan, FOUR runs pulled over midwicket - not quite timed but he's got enough of it!
Johnson to Dilshan, FOUR runs ah, beautiful from Dilshan - an orthodox cover-drive for four. Poise and style - no Twenty20 smasherama from him
Johnson to Dilshan, no run fast and swinging into his off stump, carved out to point
Lee to Jayasuriya, OUT what a catch from Warner at deep square leg! Jayasuriya pulled this hard and flat, and Warner jumped up high to take it behind him, not two feet from the boundary edge. Oh yes!
Lee to Sangakkara, no run very good line on off stump
Lee to Sangakkara, no run that's quick and short, this time, attacking the body
Lee to Sangakkara, no run just outside off, defends on the back foot
Lee to Sangakkara, no run a slower ball on middle stump this time. Very well bowled
Lee to Sangakkara, (no ball) FOUR runs edged wide of the slip for four - and it's a no-ball too! That's ruined a good over
Lee to Sangakkara, FOUR runs oh shot, shot, shot. Steps outside leg, plants his foot and drives with audacity through extra cover
Bracken to Dilshan, no run Dilshan lines up another fearsomely driven four but the (very) short extra-cover fields it, and his hands must now surely be bleeding
Bracken to Dilshan, no run patted out to the off side
Bracken to Dilshan, 1 run dabbed out to the off side
Bracken to Sangakkara, FOUR runs crunched over mid-off for four. Down on one knee and hit cross-battedly with perfect placement and power
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run defended on the front foot
Watson to Dilshan, FOUR runs oh dear. Tripe from Watson. A dibbly-dobbler and a half-tracker, too, smashed over midwicket for four. Treated with total disdain
Watson to Dilshan, no run outside off and hammered but backward point scores a fine save to his right

Watson to Dilshan, FOUR runs deft and quite brilliant sweep, on the full. How do you play that? Well, with vast amounts of cheek and confidence I suppose. Audacious and well appreciated by a cacophonous crowd
Watson to Dilshan, FOUR runs uppercut over short third man. This is dreadful from Watson I'm afraid and Dilshan is all over him
Watson to Dilshan, no run angled to short third man. Better and fuller delivery
Watson to Dilshan, FOUR runs another one! Flayed without a care in the world past backward point. Twenty20 batting at its most enjoyable
Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run prods to mid-on
Bracken to Dilshan, FOUR runs lifted over mid-on for another four
Bracken to Dilshan, 1 run cracked square of the wicket
Bracken to Sangakkara, 2 runs a mistimed cover-driven slap over the top
Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run clipped to leg
Bracken to Dilshan, no run gives himself room and chops to third man
Johnson to Sangakkara, 1 run starts with a straight one which is whipped to square leg
Johnson to Dilshan, 1 run pats it down to third man
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run patted out square of the wicket
Johnson to Sangakkara, 1 run flicked down to fine leg
Johnson to Dilshan, 1 wide well wide of the off stump
Johnson to Dilshan, no run ooh, beaten by a nice one outside the off stump
Johnson to Dilshan, 1 run not middled, but nevertheless pulled through square leg
Watson to Dilshan, 1 run cover-driven out to, well...cover. Obviously
Watson to Sangakkara, 1 run opens the face and gets a single to point
Watson to Dilshan, 2 runs a full toss, bashed out to extra cover

Watson to Dilshan, FOUR runs that is disgraceful and brilliant! An amazing shot to bring up his fifty. He ducked beneath a good-length ball, flicking his bat up vertically to lift it over the keeper. You've seen batsman to these paddly up
Watson to Dilshan, no run turned to leg
Watson to Dilshan, no run punched to point
Hauritz to Sangakkara, 2 runs neatly clipped through midwicket
Hauritz to Sangakkara, no run yikes, that turned some! Excellent ball beats the left-hander's pokey prod
Hauritz to Sangakkara, 1 run turned to leg
Hauritz to Dilshan, no run tossed up, defended
Hauritz to Dilshan, 2 runs meets the pitch of the ball outside off and whips it to square leg
Hauritz to Dilshan, 1 run can't quite time this flog over midwicket
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, no run pushed out to the off side
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run flighted on leg stump - touch of drift in the air, and it's worked to the leg side
Clarke to Sangakkara, 1 run timed to long-on
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 2 runs goes inside out and cover-drives elegantly
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run tickled off his toes
Hauritz to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run floated outside off, prods to cover
Hauritz to Sangakkara, no run prods forward
Hauritz to Sangakkara, 1 leg bye tickled off his toes
Hauritz to Mahela Jayawardene, no run comes forward and turns to short fine leg
Hauritz to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run too full - easily clipped off his toes. Good running
Hauritz to Sangakkara, no run blocked to leg
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run too straight. Waits for it on the back foot and nurdles another easy single
Clarke to Sangakkara, 2 runs dances down the pitch to make it into a full toss and plonks it into the deep on the leg-side for an easy two
Clarke to Sangakkara, 2 runs launched with greater power and intent but there's a sweeper on the midwicket boundary
Clarke to Sangakkara, no run flicked to leg
Clarke to Sangakkara, 1 run turned to leg
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, no run beaten by a beauty! That turned and ripped and bounced and took either the edge of the bat or the pad. Sorry. It's all too fast and we're now on a new over
Hauritz to Sangakkara, no run defended
Hauritz to Sangakkara, 1 run fired in full
Hauritz to Mahela Jayawardene, no run goes for a sweep and nearly top edges
Hauritz to Mahela Jayawardene, 2 runs skips down the pitch and clatters it wide of long-off. Mid-off gives chase and destroys the boundary rope
Hauritz to Sangakkara, no run a huge shout as he goes for a sweep but is rapped on the pads, but it's perhaps spinning past the off stump. Perilously close
Clarke to Silva, 1 run swept hard but there's a sweeper out there
Clarke to Sangakkara, 1 run turned off his hip for a single
Clarke to Silva, FOUR runs makes this into a full toss, sweeping it powerfully and placing it perfectly. That ought to help
Clarke to Silva, 2 runs paddled around the corner and they'll get two
Clarke to Silva, no run down the pitch, patting out to cover
Clarke to Silva, no run attempts a slog sweep but misses. And only just!
Hauritz to Sangakkara, 2 runs cracked wide of long-off
Hauritz to Sangakkara, no run clamps forward into a defensive. Good, tight line from Hauritz
Hauritz to Sangakkara, SIX runs great blow from the captain - a slog-sweep over square leg and it goes three rows back
Hauritz to Sangakkara, SIX runs another one! A lofted beauty from Sangakkara over the top. Elegance and class
Hauritz to Sangakkara, 1 run little tap to leg
Hauritz to Silva, 1 run comes down the pitch and clips to mid-on
Bracken to Silva, 1 run back-cut to a short third man
Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run clunked to the leg side, out to long-on on the boundary
Bracken to Silva, 1 run patted out to deep extra cover. Just a stroke there, no power in the stroke
Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run fuller delivery on his legs and they scamper a single. Good attempt by Haddin to flick a return onto the stumps

Bracken to Silva, no run goes for a slog sweep and Haddin appeals - as does Watson. They're convinced he's got a thin edge on that but Bowden's arm remains planted by his side. Australia are convinced - I have to say I didn't hear anythi
Bracken to Silva, 1 run pushed out to the off side
Lee to Mubarak, no run a very fast and full delivery just outside leg
Lee to Mubarak, no run tries to uppercut but pulls out at the last moment
Lee to Mubarak, no run well timed but straight to cover
Lee to Mubarak, 1 wide a bouncer, Mubarak leaves it alone expecting it to be wided on height - and it is
Lee to Mubarak, 2 runs driven hard down the ground and long-on jogs round to save four
Lee to Mubarak, SIX runs where's this gone? Mubarak's pummelled him for six over a leaping Johnson at long-off! Tremendous stroke
Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run full toss banged to mid-on
Bracken to Mubarak, 1 run yorker, dug out to leg

Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 wide charges down the pitch to a slower ball, tries to paddle this wide outside off. Poor bowlers. They really can't win. He saw him coming and tossed it wider, and is penalised for it!
Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run drilled to long-on
Bracken to Mubarak, 1 run flung over midwicket but not timed
Bracken to Sangakkara, FOUR runs paddle swept for four - brilliant! He made it into a full toss, just dabbing it past short third man. What guts
Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run very full and Sangakkara steals the strike with a drilled bosh to long-on, again
Lee to Sangakkara, 1 run wide of the off stump, Sangakkara reaches out and squeezes a run to cover
Lee to Mubarak, no run very wide of the off stump. But not wided! How? Odd decision
Lee to Mubarak, SIX runs he's nailed it! It's gone! Huge shout sails over long-on
Lee to Mubarak, 1 wide wide - and rightly wided. Lee knows they're going to try and whack him over the leg-side, but he can't bowl that wide and get away with it
Lee to Mubarak, no run plays and misses outside off
Lee to Mubarak, FOUR runs carves this just over mid-off who parries it for four!
Lee to Mubarak, 1 run pulled for two - is it? No! Just a single, but Australia can't win. They're out of the tournament
Johnson to Mubarak, 1 wide and Australia are out of the ICC World Twenty20 with a wide down the leg side
Sri Lanka won by 6 wickets (with 6 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Kumar Sangakkara, SL
